title: Ticket #5939: condor_gangliad ignores libganglia on Debian-derived platforms
description:
The logs suggest that condor_gangliad fails to find libganglia. 

09/30/16 14:17:05 Got SIGHUP.  Re-reading config files.
09/30/16 14:17:05 Can't open directory "/usr/lib64" as PRIV_CONDOR, errno: 2 (No such file or directory)
09/30/16 14:17:05 Can't open directory "/usr/lib64" as PRIV_CONDOR, errno: 2 (No such file or directory)
09/30/16 14:17:05 Can't open directory "/usr/local/lib64" as PRIV_CONDOR, errno: 2 (No such file or directory)
09/30/16 14:17:05 Can't open directory "/usr/local/lib64" as PRIV_CONDOR, errno: 2 (No such file or directory)
09/30/16 14:17:05 Testing gmetric
09/30/16 14:17:05 Will use gmetric to interact with ganglia.
09/30/16 14:17:05 Reading metric definitions from /etc/condor/ganglia.d/00_default_metrics

The way I read the code is suggestive that you're only searching RHEL-style paths. Debian stores its 64-bit libraries under /usr/lib.
remarks:
2016-Sep-30 14:32:48 by tpdownes:
For clarity, this does not affect my ability to use condor_gangliad with this configuration: 

GANGLIAD_VERBOSITY = 2
GANGLIAD_PER_EXECUTE_NODE_METRICS = False
GANGLIA_GSTAT_COMMAND = gstat -a -m -i silkspectre.nemo.uwm.edu

2017-Jan-09 10:31:32 by tim:
You can work around this by adding: 

GANGLIA_LIB64_PATH = /lib,/usr/lib,/usr/local/lib

to your HTCondor configuration.

2017-Jan-11 11:05:47 by gthain:
CODE REVIEW Looks good.
